name: krakenuniq-build
description: Build the database indices for krakenuniq

options.description: Download NCBI taxonomic information
Download partial library (TYPE = one of "refseq/bacteria", "refseq/archaea", "refseq/viral"). Use krakenuniq-download for more options.
Add FILE to library
Create DB from library (requires taxonomy d/l'ed and at least one file in library)
Create DB from library like --build, but remove existing non-library/taxonomy files before build
Remove unneeded files from a built database
Shrink an existing DB to have only NEW_CT k-mers

Download and create default database, which contains complete genomes for archaea, bacteria and viruses from RefSeq, as well as viral strains from NCBI. Specify --taxids-for-genomes and --taxids-for-sequences separately, if desired.
Print this message
Print version information
Kraken DB directory (mandatory except for --help/--version)
Number of threads (def: 1)
New Kraken DB name (shrink task only; mandatory for shrink task)
K-mer length in bp (build/shrink tasks only; def: 31)
Minimizer length in bp (build/shrink tasks only; def: 15)
Pass a specific hash size argument to jellyfish when building database (build task only)
Use STR as Jellyfish 1 binary.
Shrink the DB before full build, making sure database and index together use <= SIZE gigabytes (build task only)
When shrinking, select the k-mer that is NUM positions from the end of a block of k-mers (default: 1)
Perform most operations on disk rather than in RAM (will slow down build in most cases)
Add taxonomy IDs (starting with 1 billion) for genomes. Only works with 3-column seqid2taxid map with third column being the name
Add taxonomy IDs for sequences, starting with 1 billion. Can be useful to resolve classifications with multiple genomes for one taxonomy ID.
Minimum contig size for inclusion in database. Use with draft genomes to reduce contamination, e.g. with values between 1000 and 10000.
Use DIR for reference sequences instead of DBDIR/library.
Use DIR for taxonomy instead of DBDIR/taxonomy.
Build a UID database (default no)
Build a LCA database (default yes)
Do not build a LCA database
Impose a hierarchical order for setting LCAs.
